body.p: You pick up the ball. You can make this throw, you tell yourself. Waiting will only make it harder. With your eye on the button, you wind up and hurl the ball.
Even as it leaves your hand, you know that it’s wrong. It hits the far wall a foot above the button, bounces off, and the flies directly into the pit. Disturbingly, you never hear it hit bottom.

Now what? There doesn’t seem to be anything more to do. Ten seconds later, the light snaps off. You feel your way back toward the door you came in through, but you’re disoriented, and suddenly you’re foot is hanging in empty space. And then you’re tumbling down, down, down…
